source.name: _exclude_files
source.label: Exclude files
source.description: Specify a comma-separated list of file prefixes to exclude from the files that are read. If a prefix includes a comma, escape the comma by using a backslash (\).

source.name: _file_format._avro_source
source.label: Avro settings
source.description: Avro configuration properties

source.name: _file_format._avro_source._output_j_s_o_n
source.label: Output as JSON
source.description: #PROP_DESC_AVROOUTPUTJSON#

source.name: _file_format._delimited_syntax
source.label: Delimited format properties
source.description: Specify the file syntax for delimited files.

source.name: _file_format._delimited_syntax._data_format
source.label: Data format
source.description: Select how binary data is represented. Binary data includes data that is of integer, float, double, or binary data types. If variable length binary fields are written as binary, they are prefixed with a 4-byte integer that represents the size of the field.

source.name: _file_format._delimited_syntax._escape
source.label: Escape character
source.description: Specify the character to use to escape field and row delimiters. If an escape character exists in the data, the escape character is also escaped. Because escape characters require additional processing, do not specify a value for this property if you do not need to include escape characters in the data.

source.name: _file_format._delimited_syntax._field_delimiter
source.label: Field delimiter
source.description: Specify a string or one of the following values: <NL>, <CR>, <LF>, <TAB>. The string can include Unicode escape strings in the form \uNNNN where NNNN is the Unicode character code.

source.name: _file_format._delimited_syntax._record_def
source.label: Record definition
source.description: Select whether the record definition is provided to the Amazon S3 connector from the source file, a delimited string, a file that contains a delimited string, or a schema file. When runtime column propagation is enabled, this metadata provides the column definitions. If a schema file is provided, the schema file overrides the values of formatting properties in the stage and the column definitions that are specified on the Columns page of the output link.

source.name: _file_format._delimited_syntax._record_def._record_def_source
source.label: Definition source
source.description: If the record definition is a delimited string, enter a delimited string that specifies the names and data types of the files. Use the format name:data_type, and separate each field with the delimiter specified as the Field delimiter property. If the record definition is in a delimited string file or Osh schema file, specify the full path of the file.

source.name: _file_format._delimited_syntax._row_delimiter
source.label: Row delimiter
source.description: Specify a string or one of the following values: <NL>, <CR>, <LF>, <TAB>. The string can include Unicode escape strings in the form \uNNNN where NNNN is the Unicode character code.

source.name: _file_format._delimited_syntax._trace_file
source.label: Trace file
source.description: Specify the full path to a file to contain trace information from the parser for delimited files. Because writing to a trace file requires additional processing, specify a value for this property only during job development.

source.name: _file_format._o_r_c_source
source.label: ORC Settings
source.description: ORC configuration properties

source.name: _file_format._o_r_c_source._temp_staging_area
source.label: Temporary staging area
source.description: Specify a directory on the engine tier with write permission for the user running the job. This directory will be used to create the temporary files during the job run.

source.name: _file_format._parquet_source
source.label: Parquet settings
source.description: Parquet configuration properties

source.name: _file_format._parquet_source._temp_staging_area
source.label: Temporary staging area
source.description: Specify a directory on the engine tier with write permission for the user running the job. This directory will be used to create the temporary files during the job run.

source.name: _filename_column
source.label: File name column
source.description: Specify the name of the column to write the source file name to.

source.name: _first_line_header
source.label: First line is header
source.description: Indicates whether the row where reading starts is the header

source.name: _java._heap_size
source.label: Heap size
source.description: Specify the maximum Java Virtual Machine heap size in megabytes.

source.name: _read_mode
source.label: Read mode
source.description: Select Read single file to read from a single file or Read multiple files to read from the files that match a specified file prefix. Select List buckets to list the buckets for your account in the specified region. Select List files to list files files for your account in the specified bucket.

source.name: _recurse
source.label: Include child folders
source.description: Specify whether to read files that are in child folders of the prefix that is specified for the File name property. If you exclude child folders, the prefix that is specified must include a trailing forward slash (/).

source.name: _reject_mode
source.label: Reject mode
source.description: Specify what the connector does when a record that contains invalid data is found in the source file. Select Continue to read the rest of the file, Fail to stop the job with an error message, or Reject to send the rejected data to a reject link.

source.name: bucket
source.label: Bucket
source.description: The name of the bucket that contains the files to read

source.name: byte_limit
source.label: Byte limit
source.description: The maximum number of bytes to return. Use any of following suffixes to change the unit: KB, MB, GB, or TB. A value of 0 returns all data.

source.name: date_format
source.label: Date format
source.description: The format of date values, for example, yyyy-[M]M-[d]d

source.name: decimal_format
source.label: Decimal format
source.description: The format of decimal values, for example, #,###.##

source.name: decimal_format_decimal_separator
source.label: Decimal separator
source.description: The character used to separate the integer part from the fractional part of a number. This property and decimal grouping separator property must be unique. If you encounter error related to them not being unique when only one of them was provided then please provide the missing one explicitly.

source.name: decimal_format_grouping_separator
source.label: Decimal grouping separator
source.description: The character used to group digits of similar significance. This property and decimal separator property must be unique. If you encounter error related to them not being unique when only one of them was provided then please provide the missing one explicitly.

source.name: decimal_rounding_mode
source.label: Decimal Rounding Mode
source.description: Different rounding modes for values in columns of decimal and numeric data types

source.name: default_max_string_binary_precision
source.label: Default maximum length for columns
source.description: Default maximum length for columns. This property can be set/is applicable only when runtime column propagation is used

source.name: display_value_labels
source.label: Display value labels
source.description: Display the value labels

source.name: encoding
source.label: Encoding
source.description: The appropriate character encoding for your data, for example, UTF-8

source.name: encryption_key
source.label: Encryption key
source.description: Key to decrypt sav file

source.name: escape_character
source.label: Escape character
source.description: The character that's used to escape other characters, for example, a backslash. Escaping is a string technique that identifies characters as being part of a string value.

source.name: escape_character_value
source.label: Escape character value
source.description: The custom character that is used to escape other characters.

source.name: exclude_missing_values
source.label: Exclude missing values
source.description: Set values that have been defined as missing values to null

source.name: field_delimiter
source.label: Field delimiter
source.description: The character that separates each value from the next value, for example, a comma

source.name: field_delimiter_value
source.label: Field delimiter value
source.description: The custom character that separates each value from the next value

source.name: file_format
source.label: File format
source.description: The format of the file

source.name: file_name
source.label: File name
source.description: The name of the file to read

source.name: first_line
source.label: First line
source.description: Indicates at which row start reading

source.name: first_line_header
source.label: First line is header
source.description: Indicates whether the row where reading starts is the header

source.name: generate_unicode_columns
source.label: Generate unicode type columns
source.description: Generate unicode type columns. This property can be set/is applicable only when runtime column propagation is used

source.name: infer_as_varchar
source.label: Infer as VARCHAR
source.description: Treat the data in all columns as VARCHARs

source.name: infer_null_as_empty_string
source.label: Infer null as empty string
source.description: Treat empty values in string type columns as empty strings instead of null

source.name: infer_record_count
source.label: Infer record count
source.description: The number of records to process to obtain the structure of the data

source.name: infer_schema
source.label: Infer schema
source.description: Obtain the schema from the file

source.name: infer_timestamp_as_date
source.label: Infer TIMESTAMP as DATE
source.description: Infer columns containing date and time data as date

source.name: invalid_data_handling
source.label: Invalid data handling
source.description: How to handle values that are not valid: fail the job, null the column, or drop the row

source.name: json_infer_record_count
source.label: Infer record count
source.description: Deprecated. Use infer_record_count property. The number of JSON elements to process to obtain the structure of the data

source.name: json_path
source.label: JSON path
source.description: The path that identifies the elements to retrieve from a JSON document, for example, $.book.publisher

source.name: labels_as_names
source.label: Labels as names
source.description: Set column names to the value of the column label

source.name: null_value
source.label: Null value
source.description: The value that represents null (a missing value) in the file, for example, NULL

source.name: output_avro_as_json
source.label: Output as JSON
source.description: Each row in the Avro file would be exported as JSON to a string column

source.name: partition_name_prefix
source.label: Partition name prefix
source.description: The prefix in each partition name

source.name: quote_character
source.label: Quote character
source.description: The character that's used to enclose string values, for example, a double quotation mark

source.name: quote_numerics
source.label: Quote numeric values
source.description: Enclose numeric values the same as strings using the quote character

source.name: range
source.label: Cell range
source.description: The range of cells to retrieve from the Excel worksheet, for example, C1:F10

source.name: read_file_to_row
source.label: Read a file to a row
source.description: Reads the filename and the entire content of a file into a single row. Two columns need to be specified when reading a file to row: first column of string type for filename and second column of binary type for file content. When multiple files are present, name and content of each file will be read into a separate row. The binary column precision needs to be more than or equal to the maximum file size.

source.name: read_mode
source.label: Read mode
source.description: The method for reading files

values.label: Read binary data from multiple files using wildcards
Read multiple files using regex expression

source.name: read_part_size
source.label: Part size
source.description: The part size in MB at which a file gets split

source.name: row_delimiter
source.label: Row delimiter
source.description: The character or characters that separate one line from another, for example, CR/LF (Carriage Return/Line Feed)

source.name: row_delimiter_value
source.label: Row delimiter value
source.description: The custom string that separates each rows from the next one.

source.name: row_limit
source.label: Row limit
source.description: The maximum number of rows to return

source.name: row_start
source.label: Row start
source.description: Indicates the offset from the row where reading starts to treat as the start of the data

source.name: sheet_name
source.label: Worksheet name
source.description: The name of the Excel worksheet to read from

source.name: table_folder_name
source.label: Endpoint folder
source.description: The endpoint folder of the table

source.name: table_format
source.label: Table format
source.description: The format of the table

source.name: table_name
source.label: Table name
source.description: The name of the table

source.name: table_namespace
source.label: Table namespace
source.description: The namespace of the table

source.name: time_format
source.label: Time format
source.description: The format of time values, for example, HH:mm:ss[.f]

source.name: time_zone_format
source.label: Timezone format
source.description: The format of timezone values, for example, yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.SSS XXX

source.name: timestamp_format
source.label: Timestamp format
source.description: The format of timestamp values, for example, yyyy-MM-dd H:m:s

source.name: type_mapping
source.label: Type mapping
source.description: Overrides the data types of specified columns in the file's inferred schema, for example, inferredType1:newType1;inferredType2:newType2

source.name: use_4_digit_year
source.label: Use 4 digit years in date formats
source.description: Whether to use 4 digit years in all date formats. By default, 2 digit years will be used.

source.name: use_field_formats
source.label: Use field formats
source.description: Format data using specified field formats

source.name: use_sst_temp_file
source.label: Store shared strings in the temporary file
source.description: Whether to store shared strings in the encrypted temporary file and trade memory usage for a disk space usage. Shared strings are stored in the memory by default, which can lead to memory issues when dealing with large workbooks. It is recommended to enable this option for a large XLSX files.

source.name: use_variable_formats
source.label: Use variable formats
source.description: Format data using specified variable formats.

source.name: xml_path
source.label: XPath
source.description: The path that identifies the root elements to retrieve from a XML document, for example, /book/publisher

source.name: xml_path_fields
source.label: Fields XPath
source.description: The path that identifies the specified elements to retrieve from the root path of a XML document, for example, ../publisher

source.name: xml_schema
source.label: Schema of XML
source.description: The schema that specified metadata information of elements, for example, data type, values, min, max

target.name: _codec_avro
target.label: Compression codec
target.description: The compression codec to use when writing

target.name: _create_bucket._append_u_u_i_d
target.label: Append unique ID
target.description: Select whether to append a unique set of characters to identify the bucket to the bucket name that is created.

target.name: _file_attributes
target.label: File attributes
target.description: File attributes for the S3 files.

target.name: _file_attributes._content_type
target.label: Content type
target.description: Specify the content type of the file to write, for example, text/xml or application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=utf-8.

target.name: _file_attributes._life_cycle_rule
target.label: Define lifecycle rules
target.description: Specify whether you want to define one or more rules for when a file is set to expire or be archived.

target.name: _file_attributes._life_cycle_rule._expiration
target.label: Expiration
target.description: Specify whether you want the file to expire. When a file expires, it is deleted from Amazon Web Services. You can specify the date when the file is set to expire or the number of days that the file will exist in Amazon Web Services before it is set to expire.

target.name: _file_attributes._life_cycle_rule._expiration._expiration_date
target.label: Expiration date
target.description: Specify the date when the file is set to expire in the format "YYYY-MM-DD".

target.name: _file_attributes._life_cycle_rule._expiration._expiration_duration
target.label: Duration
target.description: Specify the number of days that the file will exist in Amazon Web Services before it expires.

target.name: _file_attributes._life_cycle_rule._l_c_rule_format
target.label: Time period format
target.description: Specify whether the lifecycle rule is based on the number of days from the date that the file is created or based on a specific date.

target.name: _file_attributes._life_cycle_rule._l_c_rule_scope
target.label: Rule scope
target.description: Specify whether to apply the rule to the file only or to all of the files in the folder that contains the file. If the connector runs in parallel, this property is ignored, and the rule is applied to all of the files in the folder.

target.name: _file_attributes._life_cycle_rule._transition
target.label: Archive
target.description: Specify whether to archive the file in Amazon Glacier. You can specify the date when the file is set to be archived or the number of days before the file is set to be archived.

target.name: _file_attributes._life_cycle_rule._transition._transition_date
target.label: Date to archive
target.description: Specify the date when the file is set to be archived in Amazon Glacier in the format "YYYY-MM-DD".

target.name: _file_attributes._life_cycle_rule._transition._transition_duration
target.label: Duration
target.description: Specify the number of days that the file will exist in Amazon S3 before it is set to be archived in Amazon Glacier.

target.name: _file_attributes._storage_class
target.label: Storage class
target.description: Specify the storage class for the file. The reduced redundancy storage class provides less redundancy for files than the standard class. For more information, see the Amazon S3 documentation.

target.name: _file_attributes._user_metadata
target.label: User metadata
target.description: Specify metadata in a list of name-value pairs. Separate each name-value pair with a semicolon, for example, Topic=News;SubTopic=Sports. All characters that you specify must be in the US-ASCII character set.

target.name: _file_exists
target.label: If file exists
target.description: Specify what the connector does when it tries to write a file that already exists. Select Overwrite file to overwrite a file if it already exists, Do not overwrite file to not overwrite the file and stop the job, or Fail to stop the job with an error message.

target.name: _file_format._avrotarget
target.label: Avro settings
target.description: Avro configuration properties

target.name: _file_format._avrotarget._avro_array_keys
target.label: Array keys
target.description: If the file format is Avro in a target stage, normalization is controlled via array keys.

target.name: _file_format._avrotarget._avro_schema
target.label: Avro schema file
target.description: Specify the fully qualified path for a JSON file that defines the schema for the Avro file.

target.name: _file_format._avrotarget._input_j_s_o_n
target.label: Input as JSON
target.description: #PROP_DESC_AVROINPUTJSON#

target.name: _file_format._avrotarget._use_schema
target.label: Use schema file
target.description: Specify if you would like to provide the Avro schema using a schema file. It is recommended to use No for primitive datatypes and  Yes for complex datatypes.

target.name: _file_format._delimited_syntax
target.label: Delimited format properties
target.description: Specify the file syntax for delimited files.

target.name: _file_format._delimited_syntax._data_format
target.label: Data format
target.description: Select how binary data is represented. Binary data includes data that is of integer, float, double, or binary data types. If variable length binary fields are written as binary, they are prefixed with a 4-byte integer that represents the size of the field.

target.name: _file_format._delimited_syntax._encoding._output_b_o_m
target.label: Include byte order mark
target.description: Specify whether to include a byte order mark in the file when the file encoding is a Unicode encoding such as UTF-8, UTF-16, or UTF-32.

target.name: _file_format._delimited_syntax._escape
target.label: Escape character
target.description: Specify the character to use to escape field and row delimiters. If an escape character exists in the data, the escape character is also escaped. Because escape characters require additional processing, do not specify a value for this property if you do not need to include escape characters in the data.

target.name: _file_format._delimited_syntax._field_delimiter
target.label: Field delimiter
target.description: Specify a string or one of the following values: <NL>, <CR>, <LF>, <TAB>. The string can include Unicode escape strings in the form \uNNNN where NNNN is the Unicode character code.

target.name: _file_format._delimited_syntax._row_delimiter
target.label: Row delimiter
target.description: Specify a string or one of the following values: <NL>, <CR>, <LF>, <TAB>. The string can include Unicode escape strings in the form \uNNNN where NNNN is the Unicode character code.

target.name: _file_format._o_r_c_target
target.label: ORC settings
target.description: ORC configuration properties

target.name: _file_format._o_r_c_target._orc_buffer_size
target.label: Buffer size
target.description: Buffer size

target.name: _file_format._o_r_c_target._orc_compress
target.label: Compression kind
target.description: Specify compression mechanism

target.name: _file_format._o_r_c_target._orc_stripe_size
target.label: Stripe size
target.description: Stripe size

target.name: _file_format._o_r_c_target._temp_staging_area
target.label: Temporary staging area
target.description: Specify a directory on the engine tier with write permission for the user running the job. This directory will be used to create the temporary files during the job run.

target.name: _file_format._parquet_target
target.label: Parquet settings
target.description: Parquet configuration properties

target.name: _file_format._parquet_target._parquet_block_size
target.label: Block size
target.description: Specify the blocksize, default is 100000

target.name: _file_format._parquet_target._parquet_compress
target.label: Compression type
target.description: Specify compression mechanism

target.name: _file_format._parquet_target._parquet_page_size
target.label: Page size
target.description: Specify the pagesize, default is 10000

target.name: _file_format._parquet_target._temp_staging_area
target.label: Temporary staging area
target.description: Specify a directory on the engine tier with write permission for the user running the job. This directory will be used to create the temporary files during the job run.

target.name: _first_line_header
target.label: First line is header
target.description: Indicates whether the row where reading starts is the header

target.name: _java._heap_size
target.label: Heap size
target.description: Specify the maximum Java Virtual Machine heap size in megabytes.

target.name: _log_interval
target.label: Interval for progress messages
target.description: Specify the amount of data in MB that the connector writes to Amazon S3 before the connector writes a progress message to the job log. For example, if the interval is 20 MB, the connector writes a progress message to the log after the connector writes 20 MB of data, 40 MB of data, and so on. If you do not specify an interval, progress messages are not written.

target.name: _thread_count
target.label: Number of parallel writers
target.description: Specify the number of writers that will write parts of the file at the same time.

target.name: _write_mode
target.label: Write mode
target.description: Select Write to write a file per node, or select Delete to delete files.

target.name: append_uid
target.label: Append unique identifier
target.description: Use this property to choose if a unique identifier is to be appended to the file name. When the value of this property is set to yes, then the file name gets appended with the unique identifier, and a new file would be written for every wave of data that is streamed into the stage. When the value of this property is set to No, then the file would be overwritten on every wave.

target.name: bucket
target.label: Bucket
target.description: The name of the bucket that contains the files to write

target.name: codec_avro
target.label: Compression codec
target.description: The compression codec to use when writing

target.name: codec_csv
target.label: Compression codec
target.description: The compression codec to use when writing

target.name: codec_delimited
target.label: Compression codec
target.description: The compression codec to use when writing

target.name: codec_orc
target.label: Compression codec
target.description: The compression codec to use when writing

target.name: codec_parquet
target.label: Compression codec
target.description: The compression codec to use when writing

target.name: create_bucket
target.label: Create bucket
target.description: Create the bucket that contains the files to write to

target.name: date_format
target.label: Date format
target.description: The format of date values, for example, yyyy-[M]M-[d]d

target.name: decimal_format
target.label: Decimal format
target.description: The format of decimal values, for example, #,###.##

target.name: decimal_format_decimal_separator
target.label: Decimal separator
target.description: The character used to separate the integer part from the fractional part of a number. This property and decimal grouping separator property must be unique. If you encounter error related to them not being unique when only one of them was provided then please provide the missing one explicitly.

target.name: decimal_format_grouping_separator
target.label: Decimal grouping separator
target.description: The character used to group digits of similar significance. This property and decimal separator property must be unique. If you encounter error related to them not being unique when only one of them was provided then please provide the missing one explicitly.

target.name: delete_bucket
target.label: Delete bucket
target.description: Delete the bucket

target.name: encoding
target.label: Encoding
target.description: The appropriate character encoding for your data, for example, UTF-8

target.name: encryption_key
target.label: Encryption key
target.description: Key to decrypt sav file

target.name: escape_character
target.label: Escape character
target.description: The character that's used to escape other characters, for example, a backslash. Escaping is a string technique that identifies characters as being part of a string value.

target.name: escape_character_value
target.label: Escape character value
target.description: The custom character that is used to escape other characters.

target.name: field_delimiter
target.label: Field delimiter
target.description: The character that separates each value from the next value, for example, a comma

target.name: field_delimiter_value
target.label: Field delimiter value
target.description: The custom character that separates each value from the next value

target.name: file_format
target.label: File format
target.description: The format of the file to write to

target.name: file_name
target.label: File name
target.description: The name of the file to write to or delete

target.name: file_size_threshold
target.label: File size threshold
target.description: Specify the threshold for the file size in megabytes. Processing nodes will start a new file each time the size exceeds the value specified in the threshold.

target.name: first_line_header
target.label: First line is header
target.description: Indicates whether the row where reading starts is the header

target.name: include_types
target.label: Include types
target.description: Include data types in the first line of the file

target.name: names_as_labels
target.label: Names as labels
target.description: Set column labels to the value of the column name

target.name: null_value
target.label: Null value
target.description: The value that represents null (a missing value) in the file, for example, NULL

target.name: partition_name_prefix
target.label: Partition name prefix
target.description: The prefix in each partition name

target.name: partitioned
target.label: Partitioned
target.description: Write the file as multiple partitions

target.name: quote_character
target.label: Quote character
target.description: The character that's used to enclose string values, for example, a double quotation mark

target.name: quote_numerics
target.label: Quote numeric values
target.description: Enclose numeric values the same as strings using the quote character

target.name: row_delimiter
target.label: Row delimiter
target.description: The character or characters that separate one line from another, for example, CR/LF (Carriage Return/Line Feed)

target.name: row_delimiter_value
target.label: Row delimiter value
target.description: The custom string that separates each rows from the next one.

target.name: sheet_name
target.label: Worksheet name
target.description: The name of the Excel worksheet to write to

target.name: table_action
target.label: Table action
target.description: The action to take on the target table to handle the new data set

target.name: table_data_file_compression_codec
target.label: Compression codec
target.description: The compression codec of table data file

target.name: table_data_file_format
target.label: Table data file format
target.description: The format of the table data file

target.name: table_data_path
target.label: The data path
target.description: The start path for storing files with data

target.name: table_folder_name
target.label: Endpoint folder
target.description: The endpoint folder of the table

target.name: table_format
target.label: Table format
target.description: The format of the table

target.name: table_name
target.label: Table name
target.description: The name of the table

target.name: table_namespace
target.label: Table namespace
target.description: The namespace of the table

target.name: table_partition_cache_expiration
target.label: The cache expiration
target.description: The eviction time for partition writers

target.name: table_partition_cache_size
